concept.title: Community Group Settings
concept.abstract: Staff users configure the fields in the Community Group Settings section of the Community Group record to control privacy and feature settings in the Community Portal.

section.p:
Display and/or hide group features to Community Portal users by selecting/deselecting the following checkboxes:
Enable Community Feed-Select the checkbox to display the group's Community Feed tab. In a Public Group, the Community Feed is to all Community Portal users by default when enabled. Private and Unlisted Groups display the Community Feed to only members, if enabled by the Administrator.
Enable Members-Select the checkbox to display the group's Members tab. In both Public and Private Groups, the Members tab is visible to all Community Portal users by default when enabled. Unlisted Groups display the Members tab to only members, if enabled by the Administrator.
Enable Events-Select the checkbox to display the group's Events tab. In a Public Group, the Events tab is visible to all Community Portal users by default when enabled. Private and Unlisted Groups display the Events tab to only members, if enabled by the Administrator. Selecting the Private Community Feed, Private Members, and Private Events checkboxes hide their associated tabs from non-members of Public Groups, overriding group privacy settings. In a Private Group, selecting the Private Members checkbox will hide the associated tab from non-members.

Staff users can create a button on the Community Group Detail page that links to a custom Roster page by configuring fields in the Community Group record.
Show Group Roster-Select the checkbox to display the group roster link on the Community Group Detail page.
Group Roster Label-Enter the text for the button label that will display on the Community Group Detail page.
Group Roster Link-Enter the external link that will redirect Community users to the correct page when clicking the Roster link on the Community Group Detail page.External link must be from a secured site.
